item.title: Report X-2024060560
item.description:
Report X-2024060560

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: THEODORE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The outer pack said containers had vented caps and to keep package upright. When inspected the caps did not appear to be vented, just simple solid plastic. The caps were loose and easily spun when touched. The spill happened when the package was on its side.

item.title: Report E-2024060156
item.description:
Report E-2024060156

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-25
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of ISB-910 was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper packaging from the shipper as the handle was broken off and the lid was damaged. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents and place the contents into an 8-gallon poly drum for disposal.
